ChunkText: stem OPT can only be authorized twice during your entire academic career in the us. stem OPT can only be approved as an extension of regular opt, meaning it must follow a period of approved post-completion regular opt. once approved by uscis: students are approved for an additional 24 months of work authorization.
ContextBefore: stem OPT follows federal and school regulations: all work done pursuant to stem OPT must be directly related to the students major program of study. students must first request and receive a special stem OPT I-20 from the isss office before submitting their application to uscis. stem OPT is granted only once per degree level.
ContextAfter: students must work in paid positions at least 20 hoursweek with each employer. employers must be enrolled and participating in the e-verify program here applications for stem OPT can only be submitted during the final 90 days of regular post-completion opt. students should plan ahead and begin the application process with the isss office as early as possible.
